text: serves really good sushi and not the biggest portions but adequate and green tea creme brulee is a must !
it has great sushi and even better service and the entire staff was extremely accomodating and tended to my every need .
this is a great place to get a delicious meal and the staff is pretty friendly and the onion rings are great !

– I was highly disappointed in the food at pagoda and the prices are outrageous and especially since the food was actually less satisfying than most neighborhood chinese establishments and nice ambience but highly overrated place .

worst service I ever had everyone that sat in the back outside agreed that it was the worst service we had ever received and our waiter was non-existent and after our food finally arrived over an hour after we ordered and we were not given any water or utensils and I complained to the manager but he was not even apologetic .
– I highly recommend mioposto and the wine list is wonderful and the food reminds me of my recent trip to italy .

I love this restaurant – I will never forget the amazing meal and service and and ambiance I experience at this restaurant and it was absolutely amazing and the wine list is incredible and extensive and diverse and the food is all incredible and the staff was all very nice and good at their jobs and cultured .
the food was great and I had the kafta plate and it was perfect .
some of the food is clearly oriented toward foodies (like me ) so if your not a foodie (nothing wrong with that) - head over to mcdonalds or some ruby tuesday and have at it !
I liked the atmosphere very much but the food was not worth the price and I may not be a sushi guru but I can tell you that the food here is just okay and that there is not much else to it .

I have eaten here three times and have found the quality and variety of the fish to be excellent and however and the value and service are both severely lacking and the service ranges from mediocre to offensive and on a recent trip and our waiter was extremely dismissive and while no less than three staff members waited hand-and-foot on a pair of japanese girls seated nearby .

the sashimi was the freshest and most tender I have ever tasted and their apps are all delicious and the only drawback is that this place is really expensive and the portions are on the small side but the space is small and lovely and and the service is helpful .
– the food was not great & the waiters were rude and it is not worth going at all and spend your money there!! !
great service my service was stellar and food was fine and with a some little-tastier-than-normal salsa .
the food was great and the margaritas too but the waitress was too busy being nice to her other larger party than to take better care of my friend and me .
best sushi in town and everything you want and more and very fresh .

the best calamari in seattle and – ...and the best summertime deck experience--they will even bring you a blanket if you get cold in the seattle evening weather and a perfect place to take out of town guests any time of the year .

– by far the best bar in the east village... I went there with some friends one night to play bingo and watch the sox game and it was a blast and great draft and bottle selection and the pizza rocks .
just go there and see for yourself and the owners are great fun and the beer selection is worth staying for and and the upstairs is a great place to hang out .

the sushi here is delicious and my only negative comment is that I wish the pieces were a little bigger and the decor is rustic and traditional japanese and the crowd is mixed yuppies and young and old and the service was courteous and attentive .

mediocre food the outside patio area has an abbreviated menu and my g/f and I both agreed the food was very mediocre especially considering the price and we are locals and and get the feeling the only way this place survives with such average food is because most customers are probably one-time customer tourists and service was decent and drinks were good .

excellent food and nice ambience and fairly expensive – I loved the pumpkin ravioli and the goat cheese gnocchi (5 big ones to a plate instead of 20 or so little gnocchis ) and my sister loved her filet mignon on top of spinach and mashed potatoes and the ambiance was a peaceful and relaxing break amongst all the kids running around in downtown disney and it was romantic - and even nice even with my sister and reminded me of italy and and had artwork and music that kept up the feeling of being in a mediterrean villa and I recommend it for a night when you want to splurge and (it was a bit expensive )
best indian food in l ,a and it's located in a strip mall near the beverly center and not the greatest location but the food keeps me coming back for more .
never too crowded and always great service and I can highly recommend their various saag and paneer and korma .

nice food but no spice and – I really enjoyed my meal here and the food was all good but it was way too mild and the naan was some of the best I've had and I really enjoyed the bhartha and not too tomatoey .
I love the warm & cosy environment .
best restaurant in the world and great decor and great customer service and friendly manager the atmosphere is great .
great lunch spot – great financial district mexican spot .
the food is simply unforgettable and the staff are friendly and the decor was ethic and colorful .

– the food is here is incredible and though the quality is inconsistent during lunch and also and they serve the best hummus in america and with a drizzle of fragrant olive oil (which and I believe is the traditional way) and the only drawback is the crowded seating and the slow service and however and this place is a gem and and I won't stop going back .

great beer – my first time to dine at this restaurant was with my son and it was absolutely horrible and I swore never to return for a warm beer and mediocre meal and the band was very good and the service was attentive and we did have the same waiter the second time and so maybe the service is spotty and our luck is good .
the sommelier is fantastic and down-to-earth and & extremely knowlegable .

the food is not what it once was (potions have seriously seen downsizing ) prices have gone up and and the service is the worst I have experienced anywhere (including mainland europe) . this is sad for what once was one of the best places you could ever eat .

open & cool place with the best pizza and coffee – mioposto has a very creative & delicious pizza menu and the coffe is very good and too and great open and friendly ambience and this place is charming and relaxing and the servers behind the counter are always friendly and helpful and it reminds me of those great little restaurants in san francisco and it's a great place to enjoy food and meet friends .
great food and spectacular location and and friendly service keep us coming back year after year .
enjoyed the food food was good and cheap and it was so much though that I could barely finish but I did and since it was delicious and atmosphere was nice and still I would recommend this place .
great food with an awesome atmosphere and the best place for a leisure sunday breakfast amidst yachts and then take a stroll through the nearby farmer's market .

great meal – the fish on the omikase platter was absolutely decadent - - there was none of the stringiness that sometimes accompanies fair sushi - - this fish was perfect!!! and plus and I am allergic to rice and and the waitstaff was unbelievably accomodating - - didn't even bat an eye !
– how to describe the best sushi in nyc : hmmmm and delicious and amazing and fantastic and suculent and perfect and nah and all of the above .
one of the best sushi place in town and the house special roll is really good .
brunch at murphy's is to die for and my specialty... egg white omelet and the food is always freshly prepared and it's the perfect spot for a romantic date for 2 or a secret rendezvous !
– best mexican place for lunch in the financial district and love the enchiladas and chicken soup - and be sure to check out their specials .
the sushi was excellent and the wait staff was quick and the price was right too and the atmosphere was just okay and I'd go back there in a heartbeat .

the restaurant was 80 % full and there was a sign posted "wait to be seated and " the pizza was slightly reminescent of baker's beach pizza which occupied the the space years ago (a distant second) . it was decent but nothing exceptional and this establishment is consistent with my feelings of the rest of chow foods group .
I highly recommend this place to all that want to try indain food for the first time and the lunch menu is an awesome deal and fresh ingrediants and super tasty .

best food and phenominal service for the finicky sushi eater and those who have sampled the best nyc has to offer and the fish is the freshest and the service is superb and not only can the selection be innovative but there's a nice balance of traditional sushi as well and the nicest waiters in town .
– this place is unbelievably over-rated .
hands down and the best tuna I have ever had .
well worth it great value sushi with high quality & nice setting and try the chef's choice for sushi as the smoked yellowtail was incredible and the rolls were also tasty .

poor customer service/poor pizza and – as with most restaurants in seattle and mioposto's service was bad and the food was overpriced and I know many people have their favorite types of pizza and pizza places but mioposto's pizza lacks quality and good taste and the only positive thing about mioposto is the nice location .
love it every time the food is fantastic and and the waiting staff has been perfect every single time we've been there .
the appetizer of oysters and lobster and crab (small size ) made a perfect entre for my wife and caesar salad was superb and great bottle of wine .

the food was ok but the service was so poor that the food was cold buy the time everyone in my party was served and even then and the order was not correct and we were still waiting for a couple items and with so many great breakfast/lunch places in so cal and this one is not worth the wait or any extra effort to visit .
when I got there I sat up stairs where the atmosphere was cozy & the service was horrible !
best crab cakes in town great seasonal fish and seafood and with a classy waterfront setting .

many people talk about the great pizza and poor service and so it can't just be the rantings of a few dissatisfied customers and it's a great little place with tons of potential to be a neighborhood joint if the service weren't so impersonal and corporate-like .
great breakfast – this place is famous for their breakfast and the food is great and they make a mean bloody mary .

best chinese food I have tasted in a long time the ambiance of the restaurant was nice and good for fine dinning and the staff was very nice and courteous and obviously chinese and so about the prawns and they were fresh and had a slight crispiness about the batter... soooo good... the walnuts were cut in smaller pieces and very crunchy and tasty and best honey walnyt prawns that we have every tasted and the brocollis were so fresh and tasty and I would normally not finish the brocolli when I order these kinds of food but for the first time and every piece was as eventful as the first one... the scallops and prawns was so fresh and nicely cooked .
– the sushi here is perfectly good but for $5 a piece and either the slices of fish should be larger and or there should be no pretense that this is a moderately priced restaurant (even for nyc) .

the restaurant was busy and however there were a few tables open and we went back to the restaurant and low and behold and we were seated at one of the tables that was available 30 minutes ago! and food wise and its ok but a bit pricey for what you get considering the restaurant isn't a fancy place and its great if you spent the day there and didn't want to drive to eat and parking is reasonably good and they have their own lot and you can park in the park nearby .
amazing spanish mackeral special appetizer and perfect box sushi (that eel with avodcao - - um um um) . great selection of sakes and it isn't the cheapest sushi but has been worth it every time .

very poor customer service and – schooner or later's charming location along the marina in long beach and average food does not and unfortunately and compensate for its very poor customer service and while this diner had reasonably good food and the restaurant staff seemed completely indifferent to our presence and and this attitude was reflected in the lack of service and as part of a small party of four and our food was dropped off without comment ;
the fish was fresh and though it was cut very thin and good sake selection .
and they give good quantity for the price and we shared the family platter and I especially enjoyed the black cod in sake kasu and and the service was simply spendid - quite a delight .

great breakfast – great drinks and corn beef hash and coffee and b fast burritos and gluten free menu and the service is fantastic at this fun place and if there is a line very day of the week for the entire time a place is open and you know it is great .

best neighborhood standby and – every neighborhood has a few great local bars that are the best secrets and the music is great and no night better or worse and the bar tenders are generous with the pouring and and the lighthearted atmosphere will lifts you spirits and oh and and the cheese fries are awesome !

good food and great service and average prices (for the strip ) before the steak came and the server told us that the steak did not come with any sides and suggested I pick something from the menu and I picked the asparagus and which turned out to be incredible and perfectly prepared and it was steamed and tossed with garlic and the steak was done to my exact liking (medium rare ) and was nice and juicy and the desert was the perfect ending to an almost perfect dinner and the dinner only took us about an hour and the prices were alright for the strip and almost $50/pp after tax and tip (about average) . but the servers were extremely attentive and very friendly .
good sake and good food – I honestly don't know much about japanese food at all .

the waiter was a bit unfriendly and the feel of the restaurant was crowded and at best and the food was good and definately overpriced and for the amount of food we got the prices should have been lower .

the pizza is delicious and the salads are fantastic and I've always found the wait staff and and if you sit at the bar and the cooks very friendly and I also really enjoy the simplicity of the decor and intimate feeling of a small restaurant .

the pizza’s are thin crust and the menu offers very creative combinations and toppings and the pizza’s are light and scrumptious and the pizza’s are not huge and the crust is thin…keep that in mind when you’re ordering .
the food is sinful and the staff was really friendly and the atmosphere was great and good eats .
maybe it is good for that one night once in a blue moon when the chefs decide to use fish that's half-way decent .
– the atmosphere is great for any special occasion you might want to celebrate and the best dish are the honwy walnut prawns - just outstanding and the service is really attentive and charming .
the service was excellent and the coffee was good even by starbucks standards and the food was outstanding and southglenn is largest location .

the food is fantastic and authentic and delicious and very and very affordable and the decor was beautiful and unique and there was a really nice vibe about the place...good music and atmosphere and happy looking people and our server was very professional and friendly .

the waiters are very experienced and helpful with pairing your drink choice to your food tastes or vice versa and if you're interested in good tasting (without the fish taste or smell) and large portions and creative sushi dishes this is your place...
big thick pepperoni

food was good and appetizing and portions was just enough for me but may not be for a big eater and the appetizer was interesting but the creme brulee was very savory and delicious and indoor ambience was modern and it's a great place to people watch .

that was the last night in vegas and was too late and most of the restaurant were closing - so we walked in the check the place and we were seated right away and the table was private and nice and the service was exceptional - sometime there was a feeling that we were served by the army of friendly waiters and the food was very good and filet mignon was probably the best I've ever try and the portions are big though and so do not order too much and the most pleasant surprise was the check that did not exceed my expectations as it always happens in most of the places and the bathroom itself is very small with two toilets and only one sink and the girl was staying totally on the way hanging out paper towels from the dispenser .

– mercedes restaurant is so tasty and the service is undeniably awesome and the chips and salsa are so yummy and and the prices are fabulous and the atmosphere is aspiring and and the decor is festive and amazing.. drinks are suberb and and I feel like I am in a third world country when I walk in the door .

– this review is for the southglen location which is not listed in citysearch : I wish this review would make a difference enough for it to be addressed by management but snooze has people climbing over each other for a chance to eat at this overpriced restaurant with mediocre food and service and so this review as well as the other negative ones for their larimer location will go unaddressed and the presentation of snooze is excellent and it is one of those places that you feel more sophisticated just for being there ; but peel back the layers and you have an overpriced ihop with a high brow menu and the pancakes were certainly inventive but $8 ,50 for 3 - 6 " pancakes (one of them was more like 5" ) in the pancake flight (sample of 3 different pancakes ) is well over-priced and the flavors were good but I have had far better pancakes at a german pancake specialty restaurant that were a little cheaper but significantly larger .

imagine my happy surprise upon finding that the views are only the third-best thing about ray's and while I could have done without the youth who shared the evening with us and our wonderful server and food made the experience a very positive one and oh yeah...the view was good and too .
